channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Funding cuts will hit rural areas hard. One station manager explains how
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Tom Michael, general manager of Boise State Public Radio, about what the cuts to federal public media funding mean for his station.

item.title: Wu-Tang Clan finishes the farewell tour tonight
item.description: More than 30 years after the release of Enter the Wu-Tang, the group is finishing its 27-city North American farewell tour billed as The Final Chamber.

item.title: A closer look at Trump's approach to foreign policy
item.description: President Trump says he's already ended several conflicts around the globe and is working to conclude several more. We look at his approach to foreign policy.

item.title: Trump's new big tariff move
item.description: President Trump and his administration have been studying new sectoral tariffs that could cover a broad part of the American economy.

item.title: The on-and-off romance between the U.S. and China's film industries
item.description: No country can come close to the amount of money Americans spend at the box officeâ€¦ until China came along. The U.S. and Chinese film industries have a long history, with shifting power dynamics.

item.title: As 'Mein Kampf' turns 100, a documentary grapples with its terrible legacy
item.description: One of the most infamous books ever written was published 100 years ago: Mein Kampf by Adolf Hitler.

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro ordered to wear ankle monitor ahead of trial
item.description: Authorities in Brazil, worried that the former far right president is a flight risk, are imposing new restrictions on his movements. The tough surveillance moves come as President Trump continues to voice strong support for the ex-leader who is facing charges of plotting a coup to stay in power.

item.title: An abuse survivor speaks out about the Justice Department's handling of Epstein files
item.description: Danielle Bensky, who met Jeffrey Epstein when she was a young ballerina, is speaking out against the Justice Department's decision not to release additional documents about his case.

item.title: Sirens and evacuations in Taipei as Taiwan conducts 'urban resilience' drills
item.description: As tensions with China rise, Taiwan is staging its latest round of large urban resilience and war game exercises, designed to prepare its civilians for war.

item.title: 10 Americans are freed by Venezuela in a prisoner swap for migrants in El Salvador
item.description: Venezuela has freed 10 Americans in exchange for Venezuelans whom the United States had sent to a prison in El Salvador.
